input.description: access key [Optional] The AWS access key.
secret key [Optional] The AWS secret access key.

session token [Optional] : The AWS session token which is generally created for temporary access to users for role based authorization.
Please Note: The temporary access key , secret key and session token to be generated by the user to provide in adapter request.
Please refer below AWS docs for more details
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/id_credentials_temp_request.html
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/cli/latest/reference/sts/assume-role.html
region [Optional] The region to communicate with.

instance id [Mandatory]
The instance ID to query

query parameter [Mandatory]
The parameter to query for the specified instance.
Valid values: instance-type kernel ramdisk user-data disable-api-termination instance-initiated-shutdown-behavior root-device-name block-device-mapping

xslt-stylesheet.stylesheet: <xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="yes" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <request-data> <amazon-ec2-rest-request> <xsl:if test="string-length('${access key}')>0"> <access-key>${access key}</access-key> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${secret key}')>0"> <secret-key>${secret key}</secret-key> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${session token}')>0 and string-length('${secret key}')>0 and string-length('${access key}')>0"> <session-token>${session token}</session-token> </xsl:if> <operation-name> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">describe-instance-attribute</xsl:text> </operation-name> <xsl:if test="string-length('${region}')>0"> <region>${region}</region> </xsl:if> <parameters> <instance-id>${instance id}</instance-id> <xsl:element name="${query parameter}" /> </parameters> </amazon-ec2-rest-request> </request-data> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>

documentation.description: Returns information about instances that you own. If you specify one or more instance IDs, Amazon EC2 returns information for those instances. If you do not specify instance IDs, Amazon EC2 returns information for all relevant instances. If you specify an invalid instance ID, a fault is returned. If you specify an instance that you do not own, it will not be included in the returned results.
